item.title: Ticket #605 (wp-trackback.php breaks API 'trackback_post' action functionality) closed
item.dc:creator: michel v
item.description:
70:

The die() command only ever gets executed when trackback_response() is called with a first parameter that is not 0. So if functions in the trackback_post hook does not get executed, then it is either a problem with one of the functions, or a problem with WP's API. But either way, it's not a problem with the order of these lines.

item.title: Ticket #575 (Images in Admin footer are underlined) updated
item.dc:creator: BigBen
item.description:
This could be fixed two ways:

  1. turn off link underlining for all links in the footer
  2. give links that have an image in them a class attribute that turns this off

item.description:
Var dump:

object(WP_Query)#25 (22) {

post_count?=> int(0) current_post?=> int(-1) post?=> NULL is_single?=> bool(false) is_page?=> bool(false) is_archive?=> bool(false) is_date?=> bool(false) is_year?=> bool(false) is_month?=> bool(false) is_day?=> bool(false) is_time?=> bool(false) is_author?=> bool(false) is_category?=> bool(false) is_search?=> bool(false) is_feed?=> bool(false) is_trackback?=> bool(false) is_home?=> bool(true) is_404?=> bool(false) is_admin?=> bool(false) is_paged?=> bool(false) query?=> string(3) "p=1" query_vars?=> array(1) {

}

item.title: Ticket #605 (wp-trackback.php breaks API 'trackback_post' action functionality) updated
item.dc:creator: jminard
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #605 (wp-trackback.php breaks API 'trackback_post' action functionality) created
item.dc:creator: jminard
item.description:
In the file wp-trackback.php at line 88 and 89 it reads:

trackback_response(0); do_action('trackback_post', $comment_ID);

but the function trackback_response() calls a die() in it, thus the trackback_post actions are never applied.

Solution: Flip the two lines. All better.

item.title: Ticket #603 (Site Admin should not show if registration is disabled.) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Eh, oops, should've escaped characters, lemme redo that, sorry.

if (0 == $user_level && get_settings('users_can_register') ) :

$link = '<a href="' . get_settings('siteurl') . '/sp-register.php">' . ('Register') . '</a>';

elseif (0 == $user_level && !get_settings('users_can_register') ) :

$link =;

else :

$link = '<a href="' . get_settings('siteurl') . '/sp-admin/">' . ('Site Admin') . '</a>';

endif;

item.title: Ticket #603 (Site Admin should not show if registration is disabled.) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #603 (Site Admin should not show if registration is disabled.) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: If you have registration disabled and a user isn't logged in, it would be best not to show a link to Site Admin since there's a Login link right below it.
